attributes.action: Celebrate our NHS by making 2nd July 2021 a bank holiday and hold a parade
attributes.additional_details:
Our National Health and Social Care Service is facing it's biggest challenge in over a century. 

When we get through this we need a national celebration of the work all our NHS, Social care and keyworkers made to get us through this. 
Make the 2nd July 2021 a bank holiday and celebrate their contribution to our country by holding a national parade in London for all NHS staff and key workers such as teachers, delivery drivers and social care workers a amongst others.
attributes.background: When we get through Coronavirus the country will need a celebration. Make Friday 2nd July 2021 a Bank Holiday and hold a parade in London to celebrate our amazing NHS and other keyworkers such as social care workers, teachers and delivery drivers who will help us get through this crisis.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303882

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
